svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Average test score in mathematics and science vs. GDP per capita, 2016
Shown on the x-axis are Hanushek and Woessmann's combination of scores from international student achievement
tests. The scores are standardized to the PISA test scale, so that the OECD countries have a mean of 500 and a
standard deviation of 100. The test scores are here plotted agains GDP per capita in 2016, but the test scores are not
from a particular year, but instead are the average of all standardized math and science test scores each country
Average test score in math and science, primary through end of secondary school in 2016
Source: World Bank, Hanushek and Woessmann (2012)
